metadata.title: CVE-2017-5041 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.100 incorrectly handled back-forwardnavigation, which allowed a remote attacker to display incorrectinformation for a site via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5041` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-browser-l10n - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-chromedriver - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.2987.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1276').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.21.5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
